headline: Calgary police Chief Mark Neufeld resigns with 2 years left on contract | CBC News
context: Calgary police Chief Mark Neufeld has resigned despite having two years left on his contract, the Calgary Police Commission confirmed in a statement late Friday afternoon.

annotations.paragraph: Meghan Grant  Â· CBC News
annotations.reason: This is an author byline and does not contribute to the article's core story.

annotations.paragraph: Calgary police Chief Mark Neufeld has resigned despite having two years left on his contract, the Calgary Police Commission confirmed in a statement late Friday afternoon.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides the main news about the resignation of Chief Mark Neufeld.

annotations.paragraph: His resignation was first reported by CBC News.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about the source of the news.

annotations.paragraph: "Our Commission is grateful to Chief Neufeld for his many years of service, both in Calgary and other communities across Alberta," said commission chair Amtul Siddiqui in the statement.
annotations.reason: This quote provides a direct commentary from the commission chair about Neufeld's service.

annotations.paragraph: "He helped made great strides throughout his career in improving how police misconduct is addressed and guided the Calgary Police Service through some very tumultuous times. We wish him all the best in his next chapter."
annotations.reason: This quote provides additional context on Neufeld's contributions and the commission's perspective.

annotations.paragraph: Earlier on Friday, CBC News obtained a copy of an email sent by Siddiqui to members of the force informing them that Neufeld's resignation had been accepted.
annotations.reason: Provides information about the internal communication regarding Neufeld's resignation.

annotations.paragraph: The email also said that CPS Deputy Chief Katie McLellan will act as interim chief.
annotations.reason: Introduces the interim chief following Neufeld's resignation.

annotations.paragraph: "We know that this news may be unexpected for many, please know that our commission and Chief McLellan are working hard to minimize any impacts of this change on you and the work you do," said Siddiqui.
annotations.reason: Contains a quote addressing the impact of the resignation on the force.

annotations.paragraph: The search for a new chief will not begin right away, according to the commission.
annotations.reason: Provides information on the timeline for finding a new chief.

annotations.paragraph: "To ensure that the organization is clearly focused on the busy summer ahead and to provide some stability as work continues to address staffing concerns and morale, our commission does not intend to start the search for a new chief immediately."
annotations.reason: Explains the reasoning behind delaying the search for a new chief.

annotations.paragraph: The commission thanked Neufeld "for leading the service through a very turbulent time" and wished him "all the best in whatever comes next."
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a direct quote from the commission acknowledging Neufeld's leadership.

annotations.paragraph: The statement from the CPC also included a comment from Neufeld.
annotations.reason: This paragraph introduces a comment from Neufeld, which is relevant to the resignation.

annotations.paragraph: "It has been an honour and pleasure to serve Calgarians and to have done so alongside the amazing members, both sworn and civilian, of the Calgary Police Service," Neufeld said.
annotations.reason: This paragraph contains a direct quote from Neufeld about his service, relevant to his resignation.

annotations.paragraph: "I am grateful for the warm welcome me and my family received from Calgarians when we relocated here, and for all the support we've received since. I have been very involved in the community over the past six years, and value the relationships that have been forged. I also value the strong support the CPS receives from Calgarians."
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides Neufeld's personal reflections and community involvement, relevant to his resignation.

annotations.paragraph: Neufeld was sworn in on June 10, 2019. His contract was supposed to run until 2027.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides factual information about Neufeld's tenure and contract details.

annotations.paragraph: Before joining CPS as Calgary's top cop, Neufeld was the chief of the Camrose Police Service. He also worked in both Vancouver and Edmonton.
annotations.reason: Provides background on Neufeld's career, relevant to understanding his experience.

annotations.paragraph: When Neufeld joined CPS, he was the fifth person in five years to lead the service.
annotations.reason: Offers context on the turnover in leadership at CPS, relevant to the resignation.

annotations.paragraph: McLellan joined CPS in 1987 and spent the first 13 years working in frontline areas, later spending time in investigative areas, the commission said in its statement. She was the first inspector of the criminal operations section.
annotations.reason: Provides background on McLellan, relevant to her role in the transition.

annotations.paragraph: "The commission is confident that Chief McLellan will ensure a smooth transition, including minimizing any impacts to the G7 security planning and other key policing initiatives underway as Calgary prepares for a busy summer," the statement reads.
annotations.reason: Directly relates to the transition following Neufeld's resignation.

annotations.paragraph: "Chief McLellan also has extensive experience working with community partners to address crime and social disorder in public spaces, making her a strong leader to continue this work."
annotations.reason: Highlights McLellan's qualifications, relevant to her new role.
